noun.description: A person handling payments and receipts in a store, bank, or other business.

verb.description: Dismiss (someone) from the armed forces in disgrace because of a serious misdemeanor.
examples: he was found guilty and cashiered

origin: Late 16th century (in the sense dismiss or disband troops): from Flemish kasseren disband (troops) or revoke (a will), from French casser revoke, dismiss, from Latin quassare (see quash).
